intro: Tragopogon straussii, commonly known as Strauss's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves arranged in a rosette. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of disk florets. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Tragopogon straussii is also known for its ability to hybridize with other members of the genus, contributing to the genetic diversity within the species.
